qas.question: What kind of database is XML?

context: XML databases are a type of <a0_0><b4_0>structured document-oriented database<b4_0/><a0_0/> that allows querying based on XML document attributes. XML databases are mostly used in <a1_0><b5_0>enterprise database management<b5_0/><a1_0/>, where XML is being used as the <a2_0><b6_0>machine-to-machine data<b6_0/><a2_0/> interoperability standard. XML database management systems include commercial software MarkLogic and Oracle Berkeley DB XML, and a free use software Clusterpoint Distributed XML/JSON Database. All are enterprise software database platforms and support industry standard <a3_0><b7_0>ACID-compliant transaction processing<b7_0/><a3_0/> with strong database consistency characteristics and high level of database security.
